Description: Body sherd of Milesian Fikellura pottery neck-amphora; beige slip; exterior: painted decoration consisting of spotted goat (head, back and hind legs missing), to right; dot rosettes and possible trace of hoof of second goat at far left; below, single brown band followed by possible gear pattern.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Manchester Museum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
According to Cook's classification system, the sherd belongs in Division III (with birds and animals between volutes) of the Altenburg Group.
Bibliographic references: Webster 1932-1933 / Greek Vases in the Manchester Museum (p. 2, pl. I, no. 3 (centre))
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 246, no. 14)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.032)
